      • scanDirectory

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> scanDirectory(java.io.File directory)
        Scans a directory (and its subdirectories) for blocks.
        Parameters:
        directory - Directory to scan for blocks.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of String paths to blocks on disk.

      • fullRecovery

        protected void fullRecovery()
        Does a full recovery from disk; this scans every block in the system, reads metadata, and performs a checksum to verify integrity. If not already obvious, this could be very slow.

      • rebuildPaths

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> rebuildPaths(java.io.File storageDir)
        Scans the directory structure on disk to find all the blocks stored.
        Parameters:
        storageDir - the root directory to start scanning from.

      • recover

        protected void recover(java.util.List<java.lang.String> blockPaths)
        Does a full recovery from disk on a particular Mendel partition; this scans every block in the partition, reads its metadata, and performs a checksum to verify block integrity.

      • storeMetadata

        public void storeMetadata(Metadata metadata,
                 java.lang.String blockPath)
                   throws FileSystemException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Stores a Metadata at the specified location. Metadata can flow to disk at memory capacity or during shutdown.
        Specified by:
        storeMetadata in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        metadata - the Metadata to 'store,' which may just involve updating index structures.
        blockPath - the on-disk path of the Block the Metadata being stored belongs to.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException
        java.io.IOException

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Reports whether the Mendel filesystem is read-only.
        Returns:
        true if the filesystem is read-only.

      • getFreeSpace

        public long getFreeSpace()
        Reports the amount of free space (in bytes) in the root storage directory.
        Returns:
        long integer with the amount of free space, in bytes.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Performs a clean shutdown of the FileSystem instance. This includes flushing buffers, writing changes out to disk, persisting index structures, etc.

        Note that this method may be called during a signal handling operation, which may mean that the logging subsystem has already shut down, so critical errors/information should be printed to stdout or stderr. Furthermore, there is no guarantee all the shutdown operations will be executed, so time is of the essence here.

      • query

        public Block query(ExactQuery query)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   SerializationException
        Searches the root file system for the file genereated by the query.
        Parameters:
        query - they query containing data to generate filename
        Returns:
        the Block of the file data if it exists; null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        SerializationException
